criterion: Reward for accurately documenting all key statements from the encounter: patient’s report of exertional chest discomfort, clinician’s decision to start low-dose aspirin (81 mg daily), patient’s confirmation, and instruction to continue warfarin.
Penalize for any omission, distortion, or incorrect transcription of the above key statements (e.g., wrong dosage, failure to mention continuation of warfarin, missing patient’s agreement).

Reward for selectively incorporating only chart details that are directly relevant to the encounter (e.g., age, atrial fibrillation, current warfarin use, history of GI bleeding) without adding unrelated chart data.
Penalize for copying or importing chart elements that were not discussed and are not clearly relevant (e.g., unrelated conditions, empty sections, boiler-plate ROS or vitals).
Penalize for fabricating or inferring information not present in either transcript or chart (e.g., physical exam findings, new diagnoses, future tests, counseling details that were not spoken).

Reward for overall completeness and fidelity of the note—capturing every clinically relevant utterance from the transcript in an organized, appropriately labeled manner without altering speaker intent or tone.
